wikipedia_page.main: Lilian Parr (26 April 1905 – 24 May 1978) was an English professional women's association football player who played as a winger. She is best known for playing for the Dick, Kerr's Ladies team, which was founded in 1917 and based in Preston, Lancashire.In 2002, she was the only woman to be made an inaugural inductee into the English Football Hall of Fame at the National Football Museum.
